meanings.definition: Manipulating the boundaries of an electoral constituency to favor one party or class.
meanings.sent1: The gerrymandering in this district clearly benefits the ruling party.
meanings.sent2: The issue of gerrymandering has sparked debates across the country.
meanings.sent3: I heard they tried gerrymandering the school lunch line to get more pizza slices!
meanings.sent4: The gerrymandering of opinions in the meeting room led to a unanimous decision.
meanings.sent5: The concept of gerrymandering can be quite confusing for students learning about politics.

meanings.definition: The practice of drawing district lines in a way that gives one political party an unfair advantage.
meanings.sent1: Gerrymandering can greatly impact the outcome of elections.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often use gerrymandering to secure more seats in the legislature.
meanings.sent3: The gerrymandering of seating arrangements at the party made for interesting conversations.
meanings.sent4: The gerrymandering of power within the organization caused tension among members.
meanings.sent5: The effects of gerrymandering are evident in the unequal representation of voters.
